attributes.background: Groups with alleged of possible extremist connections undermine the fabric of society and may even fund and assist terror groups, pose a threat to the UK way of life

rejection.details:
The Government already has the power to ban an organisation under the Terrorism Act 2000, if it believes that the organisation:

- commits or participates in acts of terrorism; 
- prepares for terrorism; 
- promotes or encourages terrorism (including the unlawful glorification of terrorism); or 
- is otherwise concerned in terrorism.

You can find a list of banned groups here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/proscribed-terror-groups-or-organisations--2
